thread.title: Rumour Mill: 19 changes in Wenger’s final re-build
thread.title_full: Rumour Mill: 19 changes in Wenger’s final re-build

title: Rumour Mill: 19 changes in Wenger’s final re-build
text:
PSG have reportedly made a move to sign Arsene Wenger, but the Arsenal manager is planning a massive revamp of his squad. 
Catch up on the latest Arsenal transfer links in Rumour Mill! 
WENGER STILL UNDECIDED AS PSG CIRCLE 
Wenger said he’s made a decision on his Arsenal future following the 3-1 loss to West Brom, but according to The Evening Standard, the Frenchman is still undecided. 
The 67-year-old will reportedly use the international break to come to a conclusion, even after West Brom manager Tony Pulis said Wenger told him he’s not leaving Arsenal. 
The Telegraph reported the Gunners manager wants to make a final attempt at ending his Arsenal career on a high by revamping his squad in the summer, with Wenger set to be offered a new two-year contract, according to The Mirror. Arsenal's French manager Arsene Wenger. Source: AFP 
However, Wenger’s decision to stay or leave could be influenced by the lure of another top coaching role. 
Paris Saint-Germain have offered Wenger a two-year deal to become the manager of the French champions in the summer, according to The Sun. 
PSG chairman Nasser Al-Khelaifi reportedly believes the Gunners boss can take the Ligue 1 club to new heights after a disappointing season under Unai Emery, where they were eliminated by Barcelona in the Champions League Round 16 with a humiliating 6-1 second leg defeat (6-5 on aggregate). PSG headcoach Unai Emery. Source: AP 
Wenger is reportedly set to meet with Arsenal bosses in the coming days, with more and more fans calling for him to be sacked. 
However, the club have denied making an approach for Borussia Dortmund coach Thomas Tuchel, with Juventus boss Max Allegri reportedly at the top of Arsenal’s list of candidates if Wenger decides to leave. 
So what could Arsenal’s squad look like after the summer if Wenger decides to stay and shake it up? Dortmund's head coach Thomas Tuchel. Source: AP 
ATTACKERS ROUNDABOUT 
It’s looking increasingly likely that Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil could leave after ongoing contract stand-offs with the club. 
PSG and Juventus both reportedly have firm interest in the Chilean (valued in excess of $80 million), but a suitor for Ozil (valued around $67m) is less obvious. 
Arsenal’s list of attacking targets to replace the duo include Lyon striker Alexandre Lacazette , Monaco sensation Kylian Mbappe , Borussia Dortmund’s Marco Reus and Celtic’s Moussa Dembele, according to The Mirror. 
The Gunners reportedly offered $64 million for Lacazette last year, and it could require a record offer to sign Mbappe, who has been dubbed the “new Henry”. Arsenal also reportedly believe they could lure Dembele to London. Lyon's Alexandre Lacazette, centre right. Source: AP 
MIDFIELD TURNOVER 
No new contracts have been offered to Jack Wilshere and Alex-Oxlade Chamberlain, with Manchester City reportedly watching the former and Manchester United interested in the latter. 
Bournemouth also reportedly want to extend Wilshere’s stay (who is on loan at the Cherries), while Chamberlain’s concerned his career has been floundering at Arsenal. 
With doubts growing over whether they will remain at The Emirates, the Gunners are reportedly keeping tabs on Everton’s Ross Barkley. Everton's English midfielder Ross Barkley (R). Source: AFP 
However, The Mail reported Tottenham are leading the race to sign the 23-year-old midfielder with his contract set to expire after next season. 
Arsenal has also made contact with the agent of Schalke ace Leon Goertzka over a potential transfer, according to Bild. 
The 22-year-old versatile midfielder has six goals, two assists and 28 chances created in all competitions this season. Pressure circles on Wenger 1:47 
DEFENSIVE DOUBTS 
The futures of fullbacks Nacho Monreal and Kieran Gibbs is reportedly in doubt with Wenger wanting to overhaul the position. 
Gibbs has one year left on his contract, and the club has been monitoring Celtic left-back Kiernan Tierney and Valencia’s Jose Gaya (though Manchester City are reportedly leading the chase.) Valencia's defender Jose Gaya (L) vies with Atletico Madrid's French forward Kevin Gameiro. Source: AFP 
GOALKEEPER CHANGES 
David Ospina is reportedly set to leave, and Stoke’s Jack Butland is at the top of Arsenal’s target list, according to reports. 
However, Sunderland’s Jordan Pickford , Leicester’s Kasper Schmeichel and Manchester City’s Joe Hart are all reportedly on the radar. Hart's costly horror outing 1:06 
TRANSFER BITES 
- With a Romelu Lukaku departure from Goodison Park looking more and more likely, Ronald Koeman is preparing an $80m move for Villareal’s Cedric Bakambu and Real Sociedad’s Willian Jose as replacements, according to The Sun. 
- Manchester United are set to offer 27-year-old defender Marcos Rojo a one-year contract extension with his current deal expiring in 2018, according to The Sun. 
- Liverpool are eyeing Burnley’s 24-year-old defender Michael Keane and RB Leipzig’s 21-year-old striker Timo Werner , according to The Mail. 
- Tom Cleverley is close to a permanent move to Watford after his current loan spell at Everton this season, according to Express. 
- West Brom are set to offer Tony Pulis a new deal after this season, according to The Telegraph. View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
